net.sf.mmm.util.lang.base.datatype.descriptor

Class AbstractDatatypeDescriptor<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.base.datatype.descriptor.AbstractDatatypeDescriptor<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - is the generic type of the described Datatype.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    DatatypeDescriptor<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DatatypeDescriptorAtomicJavaDatatype, DatatypeDescriptorDate, DatatypeDescriptorEnum, DatatypeDescriptorLocalDate, DatatypeDescriptorSimpleDatatype

    public abstract class AbstractDatatypeDescriptor<T>
extends Object
implements DatatypeDescriptor<T>
    This is the abstract base implementation of DatatypeDescriptor.
    Since:
    6.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • getDatatype

        public Class<T> getDatatype()
        Specified by:
        getDatatype in interface DatatypeDescriptor<T>
        Returns:
        the Class reflecting the Datatype described by this object.

      • getSegmentDescriptors

        public List<DatatypeSegmentDescriptor<T,?>> getSegmentDescriptors()
        Gets the List of DatatypeSegmentDescriptors the described datatype is composed of.
        E.g. a LocalDate is composed out of three segments all of the type Integer: year, month, and day.
        Specified by:
        getSegmentDescriptors in interface DatatypeDescriptor<T>
        Returns:
        the List of DatatypeSegmentDescriptors.

      • getSegment

        public Object getSegment(T datatypeInstance,
                         int index)
        Gets a single segment of the given Datatype.
        Specified by:
        getSegment in interface DatatypeDescriptor<T>
        Parameters:
        datatypeInstance - is the Datatype instance to disassemble.
        index - is the index of the segment to retrieve. Has to correspond to the list index of segment descriptors.
        Returns:
        the atomic value of the requested segment. Has to correspond to DatatypeSegmentDescriptor.getType().
        See Also:
        DatatypeDescriptor.getSegmentDescriptors()

      • create

        public T create(Object... segments)
        This method creates a new instance of the described datatype from the individual segments.
        Specified by:
        create in interface DatatypeDescriptor<T>
        Parameters:
        segments - are the segment values in the order given by DatatypeDescriptor.getSegmentDescriptors(). Optional segments may be omitted (from the end of the list). The type of each segment has to match the corresponding segment type.
        Returns:
        the new datatype instance.

      • doCreate

        protected abstract T doCreate(Object... segments)
        Called from create(Object...) after input validation has been performed. Implement this method and do not worry about null values, wrong array size, etc.
        Parameters:
        segments - are the segment values.
        Returns:
        the new datatype instance.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
